Participants.evidence: six surgical candidates were included based on the proximity of their tumors or epileptic foci to the motor cortex

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved mapping the motor network using intrinsic activity correlations, compared to task-elicited activation of the motor system

Objective.evidence: The study explores the use of low-frequency components of spontaneous functional MR imaging signals for presurgical motor function mapping

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the precision of motor function mapping, evaluated by comparing intrinsic activity correlations with task-elicited activation and direct cortical stimulation

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization and allocation concealment methods were not applicable

Result_Outcome.evidence: The motor regions identified through intrinsic activity correlations closely matched those defined by task-elicited activation and cortical stimulation

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was not registered as a randomized controlled trial
